greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the largest primorial dividing A276086(n), where A276086 converts the primorial base expansion of n into its prime product form.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..2559
Index entries for sequences related to primorial base
program: (PARI) A328580(n) = { my(i=1, p=2, pr=1); while(n && (n%p), pr *= p; n = n\p; p = nextprime(1+p)); (pr); };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 20 2019
